description: A massive new project by Microsoft hopes to use supercomputers to decipher what’s in a coronavirus survivor’s blood that helped them recover. The effort aims to help researchers develop a vaccine.
source.name: NBC News

author: NBCNews.com
title: Father and son make first court appearance in death of Ahmaud Arbery
description: Gregory and Travis McMichael were denied bail in their first court appearance after the death of 25-year-old Ahmaud Arbery. The father and son have been charged with felony murder.
source.name: NBC News

author: NBCNews.com
title: Most of the U.S. will be partially reopened by this weekend
description: Nearly every state in the country will have eased some coronavirus restrictions by this weekend. Georgia was the first state to reopen two weeks ago and has seen a 40 percent increase in cases.
source.name: NBC News

author: NBCNews.com
title: Food bank lines grow across the U.S. as unemployment soars
description: Many Americans are turning to food banks for help, while farmers are struggling to get their products to customers. States are now working to get those resources to families in need.
source.name: NBC News

author: NBCNews.com
title: Unemployment rate soars to 14.7 percent, economy loses 20.5 million jobs in April
description: The unemployment rate hit its worst level since the Great Depression as new numbers from the Department of Labor give us the clearest picture yet of the devastation caused by the coronavirus pandemic.
source.name: NBC News

author: NBCNews.com
title: Pence’s press secretary tests positive for coronavirus
description: Katie Miller, Vice President Pence’s press secretary, tested positive for the coronavirus this morning after testing negative just yesterday. Pence tested negative for the virus earlier today.
source.name: NBC News

author: NBCNews.com
title: At least one child dies from mystery illness believed to be linked to COVID-19
description: A 5-year-old boy in New York died from the rare syndrome thought to be linked to COVID-19. Other deaths are now under investigation, including a 7-year-old from just outside the city.
source.name: NBC News

author: Suzanne Ciechalski
title: Woman heartbroken by Smithfield Foods' response to grandfather's death from coronavirus
description: Vy Mai sent a message to Smithfield Foods after her grandpa died from COVID-19. Her aunt and uncle, Smithfield employees, also tested positive for coronavirus.
content: A Nebraska woman said she's heartbroken by the response she got from Smithfield Foods after reaching out to share that her grandfather had died from coronavirus and that her aunt and uncle, employees at a plant for the world's largest pork processor, also bec… [+9196 chars]
source.name: NBC News

author: Rima Abdelkader
title: A drive-by quinceañera? Latino families get creative, maintain a tradition
description: A drive-by quinceañera in San Antonio, Texas was the solution that Kristie Rodriguez came up with to keep a Latino tradition alive for her daughter, despite coronavirus stay-at-home orders.
content:
Kristie Rodriguez and her daughter Xochitl spent a lot of time planning the teen's quinceañera celebration to mark her 15th birthday.
Every little Hispanic girl dreams about her quinceañera and her wedding. Those are your two big days in your life, Rodriguez… [+4649 chars]

author: Minyvonne Burke
title: Ahmaud Arbery: Runners take laps to honor Georgia jogger on his birthday
description: Ahmaud Arbery would have celebrated his 26th birthday on Friday. Instead, people across the country are running to honor him after he was chased down and fatally shot on Feb. 23.
content:
Ahmaud Arbery would have celebrated his 26th birthday on Friday.

title: Brazil's doctors urge more stringent measures
description: Brazil's doctors are calling for stricter measures as the daily coronavirus death toll shows little sign of easing.
content:
Brazil's doctors are calling for stricter measures as the daily coronavirus death toll shows little sign of easing while the nations turbulent politics threaten to undermine efforts to combat the spread of the outbreak.

title: Solar City: The Future of Florida’s Energy (Part 2)

description: A lower court had ruled that the prisoner’s gender-affirming surgery is a medical necessity, and denying it constituted a violation of the Eighth Amendment.
content:

title: 3 Minnesota teenagers taken into custody in alleged assault on Asian American woman
description: Three Minnesota teenagers were taken into custody on Wednesday for allegedly taunting and kicking an Asian American woman at a Saint Paul railway station.

title: No masks and little social distancing at White House meeting
description: Even though two White House aides have tested positive for the coronavirus, but President Donald Trump continued to hold public events Friday with limited social distancing and without requiring face masks.
content:
